conclusion: Determine which container the liquid will flow into by analyzing flow paths from outlets A, B, C, D through baffles.
Liquids from outlets A, B, and C flow onto the yellow slanted baffle.
Due to the angle of the yellow slanted baffle, liquids from A, B, and C will slide downward towards the left.
Liquids from A, B, and C continue past the brown and white horizontal baffles.
Liquids from A, B, and C eventually reach the bottom and flow into container E.
Liquid from outlet D flows directly downward.
Liquid from outlet D hits the gray slanted baffle, which redirects it towards the right.
Liquid from outlet D continues past the brown and white baffles.
Liquid from outlet D reaches the bottom and flows into container F.
Liquid from outlets A, B, and C will flow into container E, while liquid from outlet D will flow into container F.
